definition: a seasoned pureed condiment usually made from tomatoes
intended to catch up to a theoretical norm or a competitor's accomplishments
the act or fact of catching up or trying to catch up (as with a norm or competitor), an increase intended to achieve catch-up

examples: the thief caught the purse up and ran
education has been caught up in a stultifying mythology
the … public was caught up in the car's magic

definition: to provide with the latest information
examples: catch me up on the news

definition: to travel fast enough to overtake an advance party
examples: The soldier ran to catch up with his unit.

definition: to reach a state of parity (see parity sense 1) or of being able to cope
examples: students who miss class have difficulty catching up

definition: to bring about arrest for illicit activities
examples: the police caught up with the thieves

definition: to complete or compensate (see compensate sense 1) for something belatedly
